metadata.name: Azd Azure Machine Learning Dependencies
metadata.description:
Creates all the dependencies required for a Machine Learning Service.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
Optional. The resource portal dashboards name.
Optional. The resource insights components name.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The resource operational insights workspaces name.
Required. Name of the key vault.
Required. Name of the storage account.
Required. Name of the OpenAI cognitive services.
Optional. Name of the container registry.
Optional. Name of the Azure Cognitive Search service.
Optional. Indicates whether public access is enabled for all blobs or containers in the storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set it to false.

Optional. Allows you to specify the type of endpoint in the storage account. Set this to AzureDNSZone to create a large number of accounts in a single subscription, which creates accounts in an Azure DNS Zone and the endpoint URL will have an alphanumeric DNS Zone identifier.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for the storage account. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkAcls are not set.
Optional. Networks ACLs, this value contains IPs to whitelist and/or Subnet information. If in use, bypass needs to be supplied. For security reasons, it is recommended to set the DefaultAction Deny.
Optional. Blob service and containers to deploy.
Optional. File service and shares to deploy.
Optional. Queue service and queues to create.
Optional. Table service and tables to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Kind of the Cognitive Services.
Optional. Array of deployments about cognitive service accounts to create.
Optional. The custom subdomain name used to access the API. Defaults to the value of the name parameter.
Optional. Allow only Azure AD authentication. Should be enabled for security reasons.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkAcls are not set.
Optional. A collection of rules governing the accessibility from specific network locations.
Optional. SKU of the Cognitive Services resource.
Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.
Optional. Public network access setting.

Optional. Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for deployment by script or compute.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for a template deployment.
Optional. Provide 'true' to enable Key Vault's purge protection feature.
Optional. Specifies the SKU for the vault.
Optional. The name of the SKU.
Optional. Number of days data will be retained for.
Optional. Defines the options for how the data plane API of a Search service authenticates requests. Must remain an empty object {} if 'disableLocalAuth' is set to true.
Optional. When set to true, calls to the search service will not be permitted to utilize API keys for authentication. This cannot be set to true if 'authOptions' are defined.
Optional. Describes a policy that determines how resources within the search service are to be encrypted with Customer Managed Keys.

Optional. Applicable only for the standard3 SKU. You can set this property to enable up to 3 high density partitions that allow up to 1000 indexes, which is much higher than the maximum indexes allowed for any other SKU. For the standard3 SKU, the value is either 'default' or 'highDensity'. For all other SKUs, this value must be 'default'.
Optional. Network specific rules that determine how the Azure Cognitive Search service may be reached.

Optional. The number of partitions in the search service; if specified, it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 12. Values greater than 1 are only valid for standard SKUs. For 'standard3' services with hostingMode set to 'highDensity', the allowed values are between 1 and 3.

Optional. This value can be set to 'Enabled' to avoid breaking changes on existing customer resources and templates. If set to 'Disabled', traffic over public interface is not allowed, and private endpoint connections would be the exclusive access method.
Optional. The number of replicas in the search service. If specified, it must be a value between 1 and 12 inclusive for standard SKUs or between 1 and 3 inclusive for basic SKU.
Optional. Sets options that control the availability of semantic search. This configuration is only possible for certain search SKUs in certain locations.
Optional. Defines the SKU of an Azure Cognitive Search Service, which determines price tier and capacity limits.
Conditional. The managed identity definition for this resource. Required if `assignRbacRole` is `true` and `managedIdentityName` is `null`.

Required. The name of the Azure Cognitive Search service to create or update. Search service names must only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes, cannot use dash as the first two or last one characters, cannot contain consecutive dashes, and must be between 2 and 60 characters in length. Search service names must be globally unique since they are part of the service URI (https://<name>.search.windows.net). You cannot change the service name after the service is created.
Optional. Defines the options for how the data plane API of a Search service authenticates requests. Must remain an empty object {} if 'disableLocalAuth' is set to true.
Optional. When set to true, calls to the search service will not be permitted to utilize API keys for authentication. This cannot be set to true if 'authOptions' are defined.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Describes a policy that determines how resources within the search service are to be encrypted with Customer Managed Keys.

Optional. Applicable only for the standard3 SKU. You can set this property to enable up to 3 high density partitions that allow up to 1000 indexes, which is much higher than the maximum indexes allowed for any other SKU. For the standard3 SKU, the value is either 'default' or 'highDensity'. For all other SKUs, this value must be 'default'.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Network specific rules that determine how the Azure Cognitive Search service may be reached.

Optional. The number of partitions in the search service; if specified, it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 12. Values greater than 1 are only valid for standard SKUs. For 'standard3' services with hostingMode set to 'highDensity', the allowed values are between 1 and 3.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The sharedPrivateLinkResources to create as part of the search Service.

Optional. This value can be set to 'Enabled' to avoid breaking changes on existing customer resources and templates. If set to 'Disabled', traffic over public interface is not allowed, and private endpoint connections would be the exclusive access method.
Optional. The number of replicas in the search service. If specified, it must be a value between 1 and 12 inclusive for standard SKUs or between 1 and 3 inclusive for basic SKU.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Sets options that control the availability of semantic search. This configuration is only possible for certain search SKUs in certain locations.
Optional. Defines the SKU of an Azure Cognitive Search Service, which determines price tier and capacity limits.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Tags to help categorize the resource in the Azure portal.
